attributes.action: Fair prices for domestic export energy (such as solar and wind turbines)
attributes.additional_details: Battery storage is expensive and not environmentally friendly. The grid should act as a “like cloud storage” for energy were households allow use of their un-used energy at the time of production on the basis they can buy it back at the same rate if required and/or introduce a direct offset against energy bills import minus export meter readings.
attributes.background: Currently OFGEM only require energy providers to pay above 0p for energy produced by private households for feeding/exporting un-used energy back to the grid. In these unprecedented times of high energy prices, the government should introduce a fairer way for household to sell/use their own energy

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/613896
